name: SW Hotel Toronto Airport

reviews.title: Beware of this place!
reviews.text: I did not have a good experience staying at Stage West. We were told in advance we'd have free shuttle service to the airport and that an early morning check-out would not be a problem. That was not the case! Several families were attempting to leave early and there wasn't a person around to assist us. You could have stolen the entire lobby because no one was at work. A janitor finally resurrected someone who ended up taking forever to get us out of there and then we were informed there was no one to drive us to the airport. A taxi was called but we had to pay for it -- and it was costly! We almost missed our flight because of the staff -- or lack of it. And good luck trying to get the management to even respond to a complaint. Frankly, I think everyone can do better than this place.

reviews.title: Stage West = extraordinary value
reviews.text: I stay at the Stage West regularly while in the western Toronto area on business or in advance of flying out of Pearson Int'l Airport. This all-suites property is pristine throughout. The rooms are spacious and well furnished. The rates are reasonable. The hot & cold buffet breakfast (included with room) is terrific. I've not used the adjoining pool/aquatic centre, but it looks very good. Room service is very good. The hotel also boasts a large dinner theatre that offers a wide variety of performers. It is in walking distance of a half dozen good eateries and a few minutes drive to one of Toronto's largest malls, Square One. There is ample covered parking at the hotel and a no-charge van service to the airport.

reviews.title: Terrible Stay! Steer clear of this location !

likes.disliked: — Customer Service, Facilities, Response to problems

reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend a stay at this hotel; it was one problem after another from the moment we checked in. All the negatives mentioned in other reviews that I’ve read are on the money. We actually received a gift certificate at Christmas for the Stage West Hotel and Dinner Theatre but because of the price of theatre tickets we thought we’d get more bang for our buck by just having a little one night getaway at the hotel to enjoy the pool facilities, water slide and restaurant. We are two adults and two children 12 and 14 years old.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Show, Bad Waiter

likes.liked: — nice hotel and pool, excellent show

reviews.text: Slow and unfriendly, almost like we were bothering them by standing at the counter for a room. I told them when we called to reserve that we wanted to book the special $119.00 per night that includes 2 children and 2 adults with breakfast the next morning but when I showed up at the desk they attempted to charge me a higher rate because one of the kids (14 years old) was too old for the special rate!!!! They never asked over the phone for the age of the children and I was not a happy camper when they decided to pull this stunt. After much complaining and time wasted they agreed to the previously promised rate. Why should we have to do battle, customer service sadly lacking.
reviews.title: Bride's dream

reviews.text: I am not a picker eater; with more than a few pounds on me from eating, I could literally not eat more than 2 things at this buffet.
reviews.title: Atrocious Buffet

reviews.text: The salads were all wilted, the caesar salad was as dry as sand, and the chick peas were so wet with dressing. The garlic potatoes looked yummy (like a little castle) and they were barely out of frozen stage. The pork was so overdone, I thought I was at mom's house (ha ha). My friend said the fish dishes were good.
reviews.title: It was good for the price
Staff is very helpful
reviews.text: The deserts were 100% uneatable -- dry, tasteless, the black forest cake was still cold (from being unthawed from frozen). The only good thing was the chocolate covered strawberries...and really, you can't screw that up much.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: What a major disappointment. The staff was oblivious to scrapping off the mounds of uneaten food off patrons plates. I guess approx. 75% of the food was uneaten. If you go to Stage West Buffet -- eat beforehand or do NOT get the dinner as part of your theatre package.

reviews.title: I can't sleep with this noise!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stage West Hotel for one night - Feb 11, 2005 - 2 connecting rooms at 129.00 Canadian each.

description: The Ramada Plaza Toronto Airport Hotel & Stage West Theatre is a unique entertainment complex that combines a luxurious, newly renovated all-suite hotel, indoor pool & giant waterslide and on-site Theatre Restaurant. This property is located just 10 minutes from Toronto's Pearson International Airport and 25 minutes from Downtown Toronto. The property also features a restaurant, lounge, billiards room, shopping concourse and meeting & convention facilities. Located within close proximity to local area attractions, business districts and major highways this property is perfect for business travelers and leisure travelers alike! The property offers complimentary parking, wireless internet access and complimentary airport shuttle service.
